channel.title: Error messes up whole server?
channel.description:
Everytime my server goes up, you log in but it stays a blank screen. this happens to everybody. I'm using StabbingScape V4 which is AllStar. This is what shows in the "runserver"
#############################################################
JRebel 3.1.2a (201008121555) with Enterprise Add-On! (see http://jrebel.com/enterprise) (c) Copyright ZeroTurnaround OU, Estonia, Tartu.
Over the last 5 days JRebel prevented at least 252 redeploys/restarts saving you about 10.2 hours.
You are running JRebel evaluation license. You have 31 days until the license expires.
You will see this notification until you obtain a full license for your installation.
Visit www.jrebel.com for instructions on obtaining a full license. If you wish to continue your evaluation please e-mail to support@zeroturnaround.com.
If you think you should not see this message contact support@zeroturnaround.com or check that you have your license file in the same directory as the JAR file.
The following plugins are disabled at the moment: * EclipseLink Plugin (set -Drebel.eclipselink_plugin=true to enable) Reloads EntityManagerFactory when configuration changes * Log4j plugin (set -Drebel.log4j-plugin=true to enable) Reloads full configuration of log4j * Stripes plugin 1.0.11 (set -Drebel.stripes_plugin=true to enable) Adds reloading of Stripes ActionBeans. * TopLink Plugin (set -Drebel.toplink_plugin=true to enable) Reloads EntityManagerFactory when configuration changes * TopLink Spring Plugin (set -Drebel.toplink_spring_plugin=true to enable) Reloads SeesionFactory when configuration changes * WebObjects Plugin (set -Drebel.webobjects_plugin=true to enable) WebObjects JRebel Plugin
#############################################################
JRebel: Error! Invalid 'dir' defined in class path of rebel.xml (file:/C:/Docume nts%20and%20Settings/owner/Desktop/StabbingScape%20255%20V4.1/StabbingScape%20V4 .1%20255/rebel.xml): Directory 'C:\Documents and Settings\owner\Desktop\Stabbing Scape V4.1 255\StabbingScape V4.1 255' does not exist
- StabbingScape v4 - Probably last source weed shall make! Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "0 00000 000000" at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at ItemHandler.loadItemList(ItemHandler.java:347) at ItemHandler.<init>(ItemHandler.java:39) at server.main(server.java:31) Connection accepted from 66-168-25-50.dhcp.mdsn.wi.charter.com: 1796. Client type: high memory version UserId: 55079125 timmarus is signing onto server. LOADED: 3

item.title: Error messes up whole server?
item.dc:creator: @timmarus1 timmarus1
item.description:
@timmarus1 wrote:

OMG! Thank you deathschaos9!! I fixed my Sapphire Ring because there was a space in it! Thank you so much!

Read full topic

item.title: Error messes up whole server?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

You have to separate the numbers in item.cfg with tabs, not spaces.

Read full topic

item.title: Error messes up whole server?
item.dc:creator: @timmarus1 timmarus1
item.description:
@timmarus1 wrote:

This is what’s there

                for (int i = 0; i < 12; i++) {
                    if (token3[(6 + i)] != null) {

—> (this is line 347) Bonuses[i] = Integer.parseInt(token3[(6 + i)]);
} else {
break;
}
}

Read full topic

item.title: Error messes up whole server?
item.dc:creator: @frostyboy07 frostyboy07
item.description:
@frostyboy07 wrote:

      at ItemHandler.loadItemList(ItemHandler.java:347)
        at ItemHandler.<init>(ItemHandler.java:39)

That tells you where some if not all of the error is;

ItemHandler.java = Where

:347 = Which line in that java file, go into ItemHandler.java, hit ctrl+g and go to line 347, that should be where you’re error is, one of them, also what Vince, said.

Read full topic

item.title: Error messes up whole server?
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

Has something to do with your item.cfg, a bonus must be wrong.

Read full topic
